channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The head of Africa CDC thought news of a U.S. aid freeze must be 'a joke.' Now what?
item.description: Dr. Jean Kaseya is now figuring out how to cope with the new foreign aid landscape.

item.title: Trump doesn't rule out seeking 3rd term. And, a revamp of the Smithsonian Institution
item.description: President Trump says he isn't ruling out the possibility of seeking a 3rd term in office. And, an executive order targets the Smithsonian Institution ...

item.title: How much will that surgery cost? Hospital price lists remain largely unhelpful
item.description: Health care price transparency is one of the few bipartisan issues in Washington, D.C. But much of the information is not helpful to patients, and the...

item.title: DOGE staffer who shared Treasury data now has more access to government systems
item.description: New court filings give more details about a small number of DOGE staffers granted sweeping access to sensitive government data systems.

item.title: Charity-seekers from all over Pakistan flock to Karachi at Ramadan to collect alms
item.description: The annual influx of charity-seekers to Pakistan's biggest city has gained increased government attention this year as Pakistan steps up efforts to cu...

item.title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right
item.description: The far-right figurehead has been barred from running for public office for five years, throwing her plans into disarray.

item.title: Some Egg Beaters and Bob Evans egg substitutes recalled due to bleach
item.description: Some Egg Beaters and Bob Evans egg products have been recalled because they may include a cleaning solution, USDA says.

item.title: Global shares slide as Trump tariffs loom
item.description: The US president suggests the new import taxes he is set to announce this week will hit all countries.

item.title: Wild weather blamed for deaths of 3 kids in Michigan and man in an Amish buggy in Indiana
item.description: Three children died in Michigan after a tree struck their van Sunday as powerful storms swept the region.

item.title: Judge weighs request to withhold investigation records in deaths of Gene Hackman and wife
Watch Live: Astronauts who were stuck in space speak out about their mission
item.description: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, who were stuck in space for more than nine months, are speaking out after their return to Earth.

item.title: 3/31: Face the Nation
item.description: This week on "Face the Nation," as cleanup is underway after Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed, Ed O'Keefe speaks to Baltimore Mayor Bran...

item.title: Evacuations ordered as winds pose challenges for firefighters battling California blaze
Bodies of three missing US soldiers found in Lithuania
item.description: The search for a fourth soldier is ongoing in a swampy bog near PabradÄ—, where they were taking part in military drills.

item.title: Zimbabwe shuts down amid calls for protests
item.description: Many streets across Zimbabwe remained deserted and empty on the day of a planned protest.

item.title: 3/31: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: Widespread storms leave hundreds of thousands without electricity. Also, expert unpacks the $80 million Wisconsin Supreme Court race.

item.title: Red Cross outraged over killing of medics by Israeli forces in Gaza
item.description: Six Civil Defence first responders and a UN employee were also killed in the incident in Rafah on 23 March.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre in "a serious accident," rep says
item.description: Virginia Giuffre, who alleged Epstein sexually trafficked her to Britain's Prince Andrew, was in "a serious accident," her representative said.
